mPuf3N1NIzWKSVLT.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the ability's Strike.

u7eesaHhgARKpQBM.name: Sneak Attack
u7eesaHhgARKpQBM.description: The lion deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

MtphXuwPFBdWtX0L.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Disease

JP1qrCuCRC8OH7rs.name: Crowd Aid
JP1qrCuCRC8OH7rs.description: The crowd agitator ignores difficult terrain caused by friendly crowds. Creatures within or adjacent to friendly crowds are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the crowd agitator's attacks.

AZkt2c1pf6dJSG5l.name: Explosive Death
AZkt2c1pf6dJSG5l.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage @Check[reflex|dc:10|basic] save.

eZYM8XOsF2fEcZAn.name: Pounce
eZYM8XOsF2fEcZAn.description: The vicious vulpine Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the fox begins this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

gs0ejzDUvdjSj1ad.name: Sneak Attack
gs0ejzDUvdjSj1ad.description: A vicious vulpine deals 1d4 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

YSQBrRWhZ7chtaKP.name: Metal Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
YSQBrRWhZ7chtaKP.description: A metallic sod hound can sense metal objects within 60 feet as if using the scent ability.

gMvrEneG2Stsjct7.name: Earth Glide
gMvrEneG2Stsjct7.description: The metallic sod hound can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock or metal. When it does so, the metallic sod hound moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Weak Green Hag.name: Weak Green Hag
Weak Green Hag.description:
Green hags hate beauty and purity, so they use disguises and treachery to lure and murder innocents, corrupt the pure of heart, and shatter the minds and morals of their victims. Green hags create imaginative schemes to utterly ruin anyone who crosses them, as well as good or righteous folk whose very existence insults the hag's twisted sensibilities. The complicated scandals perpetuated by green hags involve impersonation, mistaken identity, the seduction and betrayal of loved ones, or all these things in combination.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.RqX0vfUjlycKjGyp]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.

4n19omVeZZAAGXBk.name: Coven
4n19omVeZZAAGXBk.description:
A green hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

0F1cIENDKxVfgMvZ.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

hZbArhODPV9EmZ0m.name: Sound Imitation
hZbArhODPV9EmZ0m.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

LxhUmOCBKZi7FNfa.name: Betraying Touch
LxhUmOCBKZi7FNfa.description: The green hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag's enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

aTtxivkD4mgfosfH.name: Change Shape
aTtxivkD4mgfosfH.description:
The green hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

9S7ODMh2ZM6NXVpF.name: Enfeebling Humors
9S7ODMh2ZM6NXVpF.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.

8W67Bxaonilv5KO0.name: Exhale Miasma
8W67Bxaonilv5KO0.description:
The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attemping a save as normal).

She can't use Exhale Miasma again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exhale Miasma]]{1d4 rounds}.

tOZPkMShAvEm64ez.name: Pack Attack
tOZPkMShAvEm64ez.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

fhLzUg7V6h3ud52H.name: Pounce
fhLzUg7V6h3ud52H.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the ability's Strike.

7MBc0qBgkniA0qoM.name: Sneak Attack
7MBc0qBgkniA0qoM.description: The lion deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

U1G9dgOz1K6bZSsr.name: Flurry of Slaps
U1G9dgOz1K6bZSsr.description:
The offended high roller makes two slap Strikes. If both hit the same creature, they combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The high rollers apply their multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

4fiLPlktwh4Qwm4z.name: Throw Drink
4fiLPlktwh4Qwm4z.description: The offended high roller grabs a nearby drink and throws it in the face of a creature within 10 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} on a critical failure). On its turn, it can spend an Interact action to end the dazzled or blinded condition.

Ufgd9Y89ScN3I9Do.name: Storm Born
Ufgd9Y89ScN3I9Do.description: Vengeant Thorn has an innate connection to storms. He does not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by weather, and his targeted spells ignore concealment caused by weather (such as fog).

Biloko Veteran (1-16).name: Biloko Veteran (1-16)
Biloko Veteran (1-16).description:
A biloko who has led a sufficient number of successful hunts garners the respect (and fear) of their companions.

Bilokos are crocodile-snouted fey who stalk the Mwangi Jungle and feast upon the flesh of humanoids. As cunning as they are vicious, bilokos employ deadly traps and guerrilla hunting tactics to capture prey-typically hapless explorers or, occasionally, wayward villagers, many of whom believe bilokos to be cruel ancestral spirits. The most powerful of these creatures, known as elokos, wield potent transformative magic.

Bilokos have a fondness for bells, and the sound of ringing bells often indicates their presence. In addition to carrying and ringing them while out hunting, bilokos sometimes enchant bells with potent magic, or hang them on strings to serve as alarms for their encampments.

Bilokos look like slender but wiry humanoids with crocodile-like heads, rust-colored skin, and blood-red eyes. They eat only the meat of humanoids, though they can survive for extended periods of time on a single meal thanks to their snakelike ability to consume a Medium humanoid creature whole. They do this by unhinging their jaws and slowly swallowing the victim from head to foot. Thanks to their acidic saliva and sharp teeth, a biloko can masticate their food into an easy-to-digest pulp, grinding flesh and bone into a compact mush, even while swallowing; thus, they do not flinch while devouring meals two or three times their own size.

A recently-fed biloko can be easily recognized by their sagging, distended belly. However, despite their slow appearance, the fey is no less dangerous then, as they delight in killing and might have hungry comrades hiding nearby, waiting to feed.

u74JAOvwMJtUTYIo.name: Inspired Feast
u74JAOvwMJtUTYIo.description:
If a biloko feasts on a human corpse for 1 minute or more, they gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.EM0VP31B8CyjFD15]{Effect: Inspired Feast}

6mxWk9oM7RspRKLc.name: Swipe
6mxWk9oM7RspRKLc.description:
The veteran makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within their melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit.

A Swipe counts as two attacks for the veteran's multiple attack penalty.

Damaged Alchemical Golem.name: Damaged Alchemical Golem
Damaged Alchemical Golem.description:
This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

Crafted of base materials and then magically animated into a powerful guardian, the legendary golem is a living construct that mindlessly obeys its creator's commands-often continuing to do so for years or even centuries after its creator's death. There exist two known methods of animating a golem. The traditional method involves harvesting and implanting an elemental soul or essence within the newly crafted host statue, a procedure seen as vile and blasphemous to those who value the sanctity of the soul; evil or amoral golem crafters tend to prefer this method. The other, less disreputable technique involves siphoning pure vitality energy into the statue to artificially imitate the creation of a soul. The result does not give the golem a true soul and is generally a more costly and time-consuming method of creation. Regardless of the method used, the resulting golem functions the same. A golem's unique animating force leaves it susceptible to certain forms of magic, but apart from these few weaknesses, it is impervious to magic and difficult to damage with weapons.

Golems work best in play as foes to vanquish rather than allies to accompany player characters on adventures. The process of creating a golem is time-consuming, expensive, and difficult, and only the most talented spellcasters or artisans can even hope to accomplish such an undertaking. While certain magical texts-so-called "golem manuals"-are said to aid golems crafters, for the most part the creation of a golem should be something left in the hands of the Game Master.

Golems have components that can be harvested as trophies or magical components; the value depends on the golem in question. Examples of components that can be harvested from golems are listed in the sidebars.

NiOBv4JjIJLw0zl2.name: Alchemical Rupture
NiOBv4JjIJLw0zl2.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the altered alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters, and any creatures hit are affected as listed (@Check[reflex|dc:24]).

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

J7VqkP48j944i6Oj.name: Altered Alchemical Chambers
J7VqkP48j944i6Oj.description:
The damaged alchemical golem's chemicals have changed after a long period of inactivity. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no alchemical effect):

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

7HEELBDes4yzQxZ4.name: Golem Antimagic
7HEELBDes4yzQxZ4.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[1d8[untyped]], @Damage[1d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

FExsf8mar84QbBFc.name: Alchemical Injection
FExsf8mar84QbBFc.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

The syringe exposes the creature to the effect rolled.

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[fortitude|dc:19] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

Vikh67yTYfnlkcIk.name: Voltaic Surge
Vikh67yTYfnlkcIk.description:
Trigger The technic zombie critically hits a creature with a fist Strike

Effect The Technic zombie releases a jolt of electricity through its fist, dealing @Damage[2d6[electricity]] damage to the target. Additionally, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round (@Check[reflex|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] negates)

Frequency once per minute

bx6K2TyP0v8pDNv2.name: Mauling Throw
bx6K2TyP0v8pDNv2.description:
Requirements The giant short-faced bear has a creature grabbed

Effect The giant short-faced bear throws its grabbed target up to 20 feet in any direction and deals its claw damage to the target.

1LBXc3ulH9FB6m6u.name: Rush
1LBXc3ulH9FB6m6u.description: The giant short-faced bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the giant short-faced bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Young Bloodseeker Swarm.name: Young Bloodseeker Swarm
Young Bloodseeker Swarm.description: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.name: Swarming Bites
e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save) and @Damage[1[bleed]] damage. The young bloodseeker swarm gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that takes damage from the bloodseeker swarm is drained 1 until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

yOUhsa4QyVfWsVeI.name: Pack Attack
yOUhsa4QyVfWsVeI.description: The dire cinder wolf's Strikes deal 1d4 extra precision damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

CeJc7MlPNpQgGjnk.name: Worry
CeJc7MlPNpQgGjnk.description:
Requirements The dire cinder wolf has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect The dire wolf fiercely shakes the grabbed creature with its teeth, dealing @Damage[(1d10+2)[piercing],1[fire]]{1d10+2 piercing damage plus 1 fire damage} (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save).

p93B403kaFXarJf0.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
p93B403kaFXarJf0.description: Like normal objects, Synthetic Khismar has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage he takes by an amount equal to his Hardness. Once Synthetic Khismar is reduced to fewer than half his Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, his construct armor breaks and his AC is reduced to 20.

5ib8kbfq4mi5nvjt.name: Overcharge
5ib8kbfq4mi5nvjt.description:
Trigger Synthetic Khismar takes electricity damage

Effect Synthetic Khismar gains resistance 20 to electricity against the triggering attack and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Quickened Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

1ss5qypuju7sem9o.name: Programmed Combo
1ss5qypuju7sem9o.description: Synthetic Khismar makes two storm-fist Strikes against a single target. If either of the attacks deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Synthetic Khismar's next turn. His multiple attack penalty increases after making both attacks.

f0pgwkudf2q8lg8n.name: Self-Destruct
f0pgwkudf2q8lg8n.description:
Requirements Synthetic Khismar has 20 HP or fewer

Effect Synthetic Khismar explodes in a ball of burning plasma, destroying himself completely and dealing @Damage[8d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic])

Special Synthetic Khismar automatically activates this ability as a free action when brought to 0 Hit Points.

35j0ecc24cmv4xws.name: Technology Control
35j0ecc24cmv4xws.description:
Frequency once per turn

Range 100 feet

Effect Synthetic Khismar chooses the target of one technological construct or hazard; if this would cause the technological construct or hazard to attack a creature it would not normally attack, it takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its attack rolls and DCs against that creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.2ccLQxmTlTPySnOR]{Effect: Technology Control}

089AypVjz411pBAr.name: Leaping Charge
089AypVjz411pBAr.description: The fleshforge prototype Strides up to 10 feet, ignoring difficult terrain as it leaps over obstacles. It then makes a fist Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

Giant Centipede (PFS 1-03).name: Giant Centipede (PFS 1-03)
Giant Centipede (PFS 1-03).description:
Most giant centipedes nest in small groups but hunt alone when they seek out food. Attempts to domesticate giant centipedes for use as guardians or pets generally end poorly, but some tribes of goblins, kobolds, and mitflits have developed effective methods of utilizing these vermin as guardians. Other tribes and some humanoid societies roast and eat centipedes, often with pungent peppers as a savory delicacy, although care must be taken in preparing the meal to avoid tainting the flesh with the creature's venom.

Hunters and scavengers that live amid dung and detritus, centipedes are a relatively common and often reviled threat faced by adventurers. Scurrying about with surprising speed on the scores of legs attached to their long, segmented bodies, centipedes strike with poisoned mandibles to slow and torment their prey with a vicious toxin before they settle down to feed in slow and disgusting leisure.

PIjZTZsbQlriq5X3.name: Giant Centipede Venom
PIjZTZsbQlriq5X3.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:14]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

5qNTlDlAN9Nv2ocD.name: Evasion
5qNTlDlAN9Nv2ocD.description: When Lelzeshin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

9VjN6pcqznk2B9Lr.name: Mirror Reversal
9VjN6pcqznk2B9Lr.description:
Frequency Lelzeshin can use this reaction once per day.

Trigger An attack from an attacker he can see would be a critical success against Lelzeshin

Effect Lelzeshin teleports to one of the mirrored walls, emerging adjacent to it.

Meanwhile, a duplicate briefly remains, seemingly frozen in place for a second, before detonating as the critical hit connects with it. Each creature adjacent to his original location takes @Damage[6d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]), and these adjacent squares becomes difficult terrain.

IyGe94fwkUXRnvLA.name: Nimble Dodge
IyGe94fwkUXRnvLA.description:
Trigger Lelzeshin is targeted by a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see.

Effect Lelzeshin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

kpT0oqn7GdXFhexu.name: Mirror Feint
kpT0oqn7GdXFhexu.description: Lelzeshin takes advantage of the numerous mirrors in the room to befuddle his opponents, making his movements harder to track. If he succeeds at a @Check[deception] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} against a target who can see him, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against melee attacks that he makes against them until the end of his next turn.

tkZAV8EEaPwkfoyV.name: Mirror Target
tkZAV8EEaPwkfoyV.description: Lelzeshin can use the room's mirrors to send his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6DfLZBl8wKIV03Iq]{Ignition} projectiles in unexpected directions. When attacking with produce flame, instead of firing it directly at a foe, he can fire the projectile at the nearest mirrored wall and have it emerge out of the mirrored wall closest to his target. The distance between the mirrors doesn't count against the spell's range, only the distance the ball of fire travels when it is not inside a mirror.

mVq9aCEXSuZThmC5.name: Sneak Attack
mVq9aCEXSuZThmC5.description: Lelzeshin deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

N9ATPbF4EGalSynr.name: Sneak Attack
N9ATPbF4EGalSynr.description: The rebel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

fFhayPlNk37aUxYb.name: Surprise Attack
fFhayPlNk37aUxYb.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the rebel.

DMomALy5fNZ43Igi.name: Gallop
DMomALy5fNZ43Igi.description: Desert Wind Strides twice. He has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to his Speed during these Strides.

Qfkh85XuHvAlt1Su.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Qfkh85XuHvAlt1Su.description: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

oxY72lUlDZ1DPZJU.name: Protean Anatomy
oxY72lUlDZ1DPZJU.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Z1GpEdQSizMCFohO.name: Change Shape
Z1GpEdQSizMCFohO.description:
The voidworm takes on the appearance of a Tiny animal. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

3SBu5uViF2n65dfu.name: Confounding Lash
3SBu5uViF2n65dfu.description: A creature hit by the voidworm's tail Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical hit). A successful @Check[will|dc:19] save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.

ohdA8Ngr94ZPLLDJ.name: Diving Attack
ohdA8Ngr94ZPLLDJ.description: The giant osprey Flies up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon Strike.

0lofm1FWb4liRcgg.name: Virulent Burst
0lofm1FWb4liRcgg.description: When a polluted leshy dies, they release a burst of toxic natural energy. Each living non-plant creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save).

XVLgOPGMqkvkceW6.name: Burning Sap
XVLgOPGMqkvkceW6.description: On a critical hit with a stalk Strike, the target takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage.

i5KZHc9XXtvwvjGN.name: Tanglebloom
i5KZHc9XXtvwvjGN.description: The leshy causes a burst of choking plants to sprout around themself. The leshy's square and all adjacent squares become difficult terrain. Leshys can move through this terrain without impediment. The sprouts wither away after 1 hour.

BBPEHOEYoQMJzXNe.name: Cheap Shot
BBPEHOEYoQMJzXNe.description: The bandit disciple deals an extra 1 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} creatures.

ziSoWu9CFACoFzPp.name: Dirty Trick
ziSoWu9CFACoFzPp.description:
Requirements A bandit disciple is holding a pouch of fine sand.

Effect The disciple Strides. If they end their movement adjacent to an enemy, they can make a @Check[deception|name:Deception Check vs. Target Perception] check against that enemy's Perception DC.

Critical Success As success, and the enemy also takes 1 extra precision damage.

Success The enemy takes @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Failure No effect.

Critical Failure The bandit disciple drops their pouch of fine sand, spilling and rendering it useless.

urpjbgyf46jcb1zm.name: Bloody
urpjbgyf46jcb1zm.description: The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains fast healing 1.

KIM4GGcs2YWfve43.name: Powerful Charge
KIM4GGcs2YWfve43.description:
The mountain goat Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn attack.

If the mountain goat moved at least 20 feet, its Push increases to 10 feet on a hit.

o8xqYNfkyXKyj1vz.name: Necrotic Infusion
o8xqYNfkyXKyj1vz.description:
If the next action Ralthiss takes is to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} to restore Hit Points to a single undead creature, the target then deals an additional @Damage[1d6[void]] damage with its melee weapons and unarmed attacks until the end of its next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.eecIuD6sGPX0FJcT]{Effect: Divine Infusion}

pIqOXAMnVdieo6fD.name: Sap Life
pIqOXAMnVdieo6fD.description: When Ralthiss casts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and damages at least one living creature, he regains Hit Points equal to the spell rank of his harm spell.

fubdZdYViakyxZv7.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
fubdZdYViakyxZv7.description:
Like normal objects, a spirit guardian statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 16.

lIOY6nIok0PCCDbY.name: Follow Trespasser
lIOY6nIok0PCCDbY.description:
Trigger A creature moves through the animated guardian statue's reach.

Effect The statue moves up to 20 feet in pursuit of the creature.

wONgUhJivI5PjoJk.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Illusions

0VopZ8G4kis6ewnw.name: Run Away!
0VopZ8G4kis6ewnw.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Zatqualmish

Effect Zatqualmish Strides up to 10 feet (or his Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). He must end his movement in a location that isn't within 5 feet of a foe.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

h6atuahkarabhrr4.name: Hazard Spotter
h6atuahkarabhrr4.description: The ambusher automatically attempts a secret Perception check to notice a hazard when they are within 10 feet of the hazard.

2s0k1wnywt3bxhmq.name: Trick Attack
2s0k1wnywt3bxhmq.description: The ambusher musters their guile to attempt a clever attack that catches their foe unprepared. The ambusher chooses one of their weapons. The next attack with that weapon deals an extra 2d6 precision damage. In addition, the ambusher can Interact to draw the weapon (or to reload it if they choose the sniper rifle).

Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01).name: Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01)
Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01).description:
Ceustodaemons are formed from the souls of vile mortals, particularly those who took efforts to hasten their own death, their willingness shaping them into daemonic servants. Their otherworldly senses make them useful for protecting vaults and similar locations on the Material Plane. Ceustodaemons are created to serve, but always seek ways to subvert their bindings, so they can rend their mortal summoners' flesh. The worst type of conjurer calls upon ceustodaemons merely to set them free into the world in hopes of currying favor with the powers of Abaddon.

Denizens of the bleak and terrible plane of Abaddon, daemons are shaped by and devoted to the destruction of life in all its forms. They seek the death of every mortal being by the most painful and horrible means possible, all in service to the apocalyptic entities known as the Four Horsemen. Each kind of daemon represents a different way to die, and their powers are nearly always aimed at spreading that particular form of death. Through the use of these powers, they seek to drag all existence down into a pit of hopelessness and despair, and to commit all souls to oblivion.

While those who summon daemons to the Material Plane usually seek to use the creatures' destructive and corrupting powers for their own ends, daemons always look for ways to spread fear, doubt, and despair wherever they go. Often, daemons disguise their plots as the workings of other fiends, knowing that such confusion compounds mortals' fear.

While all fiends seek to tempt mortals into lives of evil to increase their own numbers and power on their native planes, daemons are further driven by a supernatural hunger for mortal souls and use a variety of methods-not least of which is the cacodaemons' soul gems-to entrap them. On Abaddon and in other forbidding places across the multiverse, souls are simultaneously a delicacy, a trade good, and a source of magical power, and the daemons are among the greatest gluttons, merchants, and abusers of this spiritual "resource."

qf9VkXweMZaEf2DP.name: Breath Weapon
qf9VkXweMZaEf2DP.description:
The ceustodaemon breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the cone take @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The ceustodaemon and each creature that fails the save catch fire, taking @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage.

The breath weapon can't be used again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

WI20ZnQYqmSIaz3B.name: Drawn to Service
WI20ZnQYqmSIaz3B.description: When bringing a ceustodaemon to another plane with effects like a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{Planar Servitor} ritual, the primary and secondary skill DCs are reduced by 5, and the ceustodaemon demands only half the normal cost for its service.

5McIXOemuKXFd7Ep.name: Vicious Wounds
5McIXOemuKXFd7Ep.description:
On a successful jaws or claw Strike, the ceustodaemon viciously tears into its victim as similar wounds appear on its own body. The target takes an extra [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 amount of damage}, and the ceustodaemon takes the same extra damage.

If this extra damage to the target is doubled, due to a critical hit, the ceustodaemon takes double damage as well.

Guard (PFS 1-17).name: Guard (PFS 1-17)
Guard (PFS 1-17).description:
Guards are rank-and-file members of a town watch or city guard, trained to look for trouble, take down criminals, and follow orders. They are a match for only the most fledgling of adventurers and criminals, but, given time, the settlement can usually muster them in numbers sufficient to neutralize most threats.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. In good-aligned societies, these officials carry out their duties fairly. In neutral and evil ones, these officials can be harsh and cruel (with an altered alignment to reflect this), imposing severe punishments on those who can't pay for mercy.

Elite Prefect (Fist) (3-4).name: Elite Prefect (Fist) (3-4)
Elite Prefect (Fist) (3-4).description: This NPC is the same as Prefect (3-4) with the elite template EXCEPT that its damage is 1d10+6 instead of 1d8+8.

JFLlg2bZWCLVLPTw.name: Adolescent Sea Serpent Algae
JFLlg2bZWCLVLPTw.description:
The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent's neck is full of psychotropic algae.

Saving throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20|name:Adolescent Sea Serpent Algae Poison]

Maximum duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and, if flying, spends its first action each turn to descend 20 feet (1 round)

2dCxELrxVI7zUWB3.name: Spine Rake
2dCxELrxVI7zUWB3.description: The young sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or Strides. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes @Damage[(1d8+4)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

GzdybGnrkPAKBmak.name: Leaping Charge
GzdybGnrkPAKBmak.description: The fleshforge prototype Strides up to 10 feet, ignoring difficult terrain as it leaps over obstacles. It then makes a fist Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

nsZ6hhutzrffFiw1.name: Nimble Dodge
nsZ6hhutzrffFiw1.description:
Trigger Mirror Lelzeshin is targeted by a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see.

Effect Mirror Lelzeshin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

sk4uzxnxcxXoloZY.name: Sneak Attack
sk4uzxnxcxXoloZY.description: Mirror Lelzeshin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Gqb0cGexC5JlSvzj.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Fear

brwvv86bhn42d4ry.name: Pain Frenzy
brwvv86bhn42d4ry.description:
Whenever the krooth is damaged by a critical hit, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of its next turn. It can't use reactions while this frenzy lasts.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.tJx9B2e3AET6PbJD]{Effect: Pain Frenzy}

nh7cdm5x01gj00vx.name: Poison Tooth
nh7cdm5x01gj00vx.description:
Requirements The krooth damaged a creature with its jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn

Effect The krooth snaps off one of its teeth in the creature it hit. The creature takes @Damage[1d6[bleed]] and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Neither the persistent bleed damage nor the drained condition can be healed while the tooth remains. Removing the tooth safely requires a successful @Check[medicine|dc:24|traits:action:administer-first-aid] check to Administer First Aid. Instead of ending bleeding or stabilizing, this removes the drained condition, but it doesn't automatically end the bleed damage.

gzDoX5dnjdXsoSaW.name: Flurry of Slaps
gzDoX5dnjdXsoSaW.description:
The offended gambler makes two slap Strikes. If both hit the same creature, they combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The gamblers apply their multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

cEfIoUeeMDjfNctl.name: Throw Drink
cEfIoUeeMDjfNctl.description: The offended gambler grabs a nearby drink and throws it in the face of a creature within 10 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} on a critical failure). On its turn, the affected creature can spend an Interact action to end the dazzled or blinded condition.

de5ejZxkZ6qiodAa.name: Swear Vengeance
de5ejZxkZ6qiodAa.description:
Trigger A creature that Reast can see damages a follower of Groetus other than Reast

Effect Reast gains the effect of a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike} spell. If Reast makes an attack roll against anyone other than the triggering creature, the true strike ends with no effect.

Reast can use this reaction once per day.

3gJt7OKe8IT8qqZ9.name: Sneak Attack
3gJt7OKe8IT8qqZ9.description: The bandit deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

1JjGUM8x0jbxEkTR.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

4OwYwgZOlBOwDmI5.name: Infernal Detonations
4OwYwgZOlBOwDmI5.description:
Trigger A creature Nashaxian can see steps on one of the 10-foot-by-10-foot patches of flame in the throne room hallway

Effect The creature and any other creatures above that patch take @Damage[(1d6+2)[fire]] damage.

sv9F97EEkjO7TKpj.name: Avernal Fever
sv9F97EEkjO7TKpj.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

68T6oEQCFq5ubFhf.name: Infernal Wound
68T6oEQCFq5ubFhf.description:
Nashaxian's glaive Strike also deals @Damage[1d6[bleed]] that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.inLBsuLRE5xmVHdn]{Effect: Infernal Wound}

c4GjKrBmfM2pJB5S.name: Reposition
c4GjKrBmfM2pJB5S.description:
Trigger Nashaxian's hits a creature with a glaive Strike.

Effect Nashaxian moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the Nashaxian's glaive.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

n8uAbvbBzjI1SzyE.name: Wriggling Beard
n8uAbvbBzjI1SzyE.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Nashaxian makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

B8mvt1ZNTGEoWCSs.name: Pesticide
B8mvt1ZNTGEoWCSs.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

mx38RpF2iCeWWNqW.name: Brutal Beating
mx38RpF2iCeWWNqW.description:
The ruffian's brutality shakes foes' confidence.

When the ruffian deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and the ruffian can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is forced movement).

2tD3E9N0SILIzzTf.name: Snagging Strike
2tD3E9N0SILIzzTf.description:
Trigger The ruffian has one hand free, and their target is within reach of that hand.

Effect The ruffian makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the ruffian's next turn or until it leaves the ruffian's reach, whichever comes first.

FvetFejyN15f6MQv.name: Sneak Attack
FvetFejyN15f6MQv.description: The ruffian deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

5pc9LLxY31zYcOuQ.name: Sap Life
5pc9LLxY31zYcOuQ.description: When Ralthiss casts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and damages at least one living creature, he regains Hit Points equal to the spell rank of his harm spell.

Effect Lelzeshin teleports to one of the mirrored walls, emerging adjacent to it.

Meanwhile, a duplicate briefly remains, seemingly frozen in place for a second, before detonating as the critical hit connects with it. Each creature adjacent to his original location takes @Damage[4d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]), and these adjacent squares becomes difficult terrain

HabyYYt8vSAuYcJx.name: Nimble Dodge
HabyYYt8vSAuYcJx.description:
Trigger Lelzeshin is targeted by a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see.

Effect Lelzeshin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

mXpx6i3rcNhCCh2K.name: Mirror Feint
mXpx6i3rcNhCCh2K.description: Lelzeshin takes advantage of the numerous mirrors in the room to befuddle his opponents, making his movements harder to track. If he succeeds at a @Check[deception] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} against a target who can see him, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against melee attacks that he makes against them until the end of his next turn.

YDidocTnwlOO0h8F.name: Mirror Target
YDidocTnwlOO0h8F.description: Lelzeshin can use the room's mirrors to send his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6DfLZBl8wKIV03Iq]{Ignition} projectiles in unexpected directions. The distance between the mirrors doesn't count against the spell's range, only the distance the ball of fire travels when it is not inside a mirror.

ckbkkA2DpGxlXYoU.name: Sneak Attack
ckbkkA2DpGxlXYoU.description: Lelzeshin deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7RYfL3pdW794bMch.name: Covetous Flames
7RYfL3pdW794bMch.description: Any weapon the ascendant holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while they hold it.

Xmjisl9KBlX1Cq7D.name: Furious Wings
Xmjisl9KBlX1Cq7D.description: The ascendant beats their wings in a frenzied motion, creating a powerful blast of wind that disperses fog and gases, blows objects of light Bulk or less away. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the ascendant must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or be pushed 5 feet away from the ascendant, or 10 feet on a critical failure. A flying creature that fails its save gets a critical failure instead.

Dryad (1-16).name: Dryad (1-16)
Dryad (1-16).description:
Dryads are fey guardians of the trees and creatures who dwell in wooded areas. They prefer using indirect methods to dissuade those who would harm their sacred groves and beloved forests, but they are not above using enchantments to enlist the aid of allies when evil threats cannot be dissuaded with words alone. In times of peace, dryads happily live secluded lives inside their trees, and a community at harmony with nature might not even realize a dryad lives nearby.

Though they watch over all the woods around them, dryads are inextricably tied to a specific tree, usually an oak. Dryads who are bonded to another type of tree are fundamentally the same, but they may differ in temperament and appearance to match their ward. For instance, kraneiai, or cherry-tree dryads, have beautiful pink coloration and concern themselves with the fragile beauty of life.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

03GLgyeAGjU6XdPt.name: Nature Empathy
03GLgyeAGjU6XdPt.description: The dryad can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals and plants.

8uoOHgzV0mRLhzhE.name: Tree Dependent
8uoOHgzV0mRLhzhE.description: A dryad is mystically bonded to a single great tree and must remain within 300 feet of it. If she moves beyond that range, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and is unable to recover. She must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save every hour or increase the sickened value by 1 (to a maximum of sickened 4). After 24 hours, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, with this value increasing by 1 every additional 24 hours. A dryad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new tree.

nu6HxTKMW550KwDx.name: Tree Meld
nu6HxTKMW550KwDx.description:
The dryad touches a tree of enough volume to contain her and merges into it for as long as she wishes. She can Cast a Spell while inside as long as the spell doesn't require a line of effect outside the tree. She can hear, but not see, what's going on outside the tree. She can Dismiss this effect.

Significant physical damage dealt to the tree expels the dryad from the tree and deals [[/r {3d6}]]{3d6 damage} to her. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Magic Passage} expels the dryad without dealing damage.

If a dryad uses this ability on her bonded tree, she instead enters an extradimensional living space within the tree; Tree Meld gains the extradimensional trait. A dryad can bring up to two other creatures with her when entering her home within her bonded tree. The dryad can still be expelled from this space as above.

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01)
Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).description:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.name: Slow
TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

lVjydvACaQe5413Q.name: Corpse Throwing
lVjydvACaQe5413Q.description: A zombie hulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Xo4IGzw28hivgMmM]{Zombie Shamblers}, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.

oGTXq7oHJ3qW09Pk.name: Wide Swing
oGTXq7oHJ3qW09Pk.description: The zombie hulk makes a hunk of meat Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie hulk's multiple attack penalty.

Injured Sewer Ooze.name: Injured Sewer Ooze
Injured Sewer Ooze.description:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.name: Motion Sense
VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.description: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.name: Filth Wave
mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[acid]] damage and take a -10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}). A creature can spend and Interact action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.

Ogre Glutton (PFS 1-05).name: Ogre Glutton (PFS 1-05)
Ogre Glutton (PFS 1-05).description:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled down whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of its own game can often enrage and frustrate the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum is more than enough distraction to afford a last-ditch escape from doom.

Ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are as strong as they are cruel. Ogres are sadists that enjoy remorseless murder, torture, degradation, and mutilation in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on smaller humanoids-the smaller and more beautiful, the better-ogres promise a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp. But for all their creativity in developing methods of violence, ogres often remain too dim-witted to realize that their playthings lack an ogre's robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, so most captives die far sooner than the ogres might prefer. Such a fate is perhaps preferable however, as those who survive too long as ogres' playthings suffer lasting mental scars from the horrifying abuse. A captive able to keep their wits can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, meatier captives, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. Ogres practice incest regularly, believing that it makes for stronger familial bonds, and most ogres are misshapen or mutated from generations of inbreeding. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"-usually the family's patriarch or matriarch-while other ogres in the family learn to obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. These lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity.

SzfxfFohnnwRyEeK.name: Glutton's Feast
SzfxfFohnnwRyEeK.description: If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws Strike, they gain [[/r 1d4 #Temporary Hit Points]]{1d4 temporary Hit Points} for 1 minute.

DvjFG8xZGQmhN7AK.name: Glutton's Rush
DvjFG8xZGQmhN7AK.description: The ogre glutton Strides twice and makes a jaws Strike. If they damage a living creature with this Strike, the temporary Hit Points they receive from Glutton's Feast is increased to [[/r 2d4 #Temporary Hit Points]]{2d4}.

xfwwRUdBAyJITWRI.name: Support
xfwwRUdBAyJITWRI.description: The animal companion supports its druid master, tearing tendons with each opening. Until the start of the druid's next turn, any Strikes that damage targets that the animal companion threatens give the target a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (-10 on a critical success). While using Support, the only other actions an animal companion can use on its turn are movement actions to get into position. If an animal companion has used any other actions on its turn, it cannot Support its master.

Kobold Dragon Mage (1-14).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (1-14)
Kobold Dragon Mage (1-14).description:
Kobold dragon mages use magic to carry out their secret schemes. The presence of a dragon mage in a kobold warren is one of the greatest testaments to the kobolds' claim to draconic heritage.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

lFKVQJSD5lmRIdIT.name: Illusory Retreat
lFKVQJSD5lmRIdIT.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements The kobold dragon mage is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The dragon mage creates an illusion of itself in its square and then becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} (with the effects of a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell) for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Illusory Retreat]]{1d4 rounds}. The dragon mage can move up to half its Speed, but it must end its movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemies.

This is a 1st-rank spell that requires a somatic component.

Jbwsklh5EkT2Y0ub.name: Sneak Attack
Jbwsklh5EkT2Y0ub.description: The dragon mage deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Kobold Warrior (PFS 1-11).name: Kobold Warrior (PFS 1-11)
Kobold Warrior (PFS 1-11).description:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.name: Hurried Retreat
dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.description:
Requirements The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.name: Sneak Attack
D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.description: The kobold warrior deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Weak Spider Swarm.name: Weak Spider Swarm
Weak Spider Swarm.description:
An abundance of food, the sudden hatching of a clutch of eggs, or magical influence can cause smaller spiders to gather in terrifying, deadly masses.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

NIgj8uAlgosxMdVf.name: Spider Swarm Venom
NIgj8uAlgosxMdVf.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:13]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d4[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round).

bEsmMOS1PqhLHHbh.name: Swarming Bites
bEsmMOS1PqhLHHbh.description: Each enemy in the spider swarm's space takes @Damage[(1d4-1)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to spider swarm venom.

4qQGeUBrlcedG0kG.name: Dirty Fighting
4qQGeUBrlcedG0kG.description:
A mercenary throws dirt in an opponent's eyes or performs similar underhanded trick.

Effect The opponent must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save. On a failure, the PC gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} condition for one round. On a critical failure, the duration increases to 2 rounds.

Y34vGk5mv5Z0DGUI.name: Clawed Feet
Y34vGk5mv5Z0DGUI.description:
Trigger Paravaax is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it.

Effect Paravaax makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

AiI98j6oLGIXcFhi.name: Lodestone Aura
AiI98j6oLGIXcFhi.description: 30 feet. Paravaax's body exudes a powerful, fluctuating magnetic field that makes any opponent wearing or primarily comprised of metal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they are within the aura and for 1 round thereafter. In addition, attacks targeting Paravaax made with metal weapons, or weapons whose primary striking surface is metal such as most arrows and bolts, suffer a -2 status penalty. Creatures exposed to this aura for several weeks (such as the elementals comprising Paravaax's "court") eventually become immune to this effect.

U2LGRVs6KQHKvXDq.name: Lodestone Statue
U2LGRVs6KQHKvXDq.description: Until the next time it acts, Paravaax appears to be a statue. It has an automatic result of 32 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue. While disguised in this manner, Paravaax can increase the radius of his lodestone aura by up to 100 miles or return the radius to normal as a free action.

7qsNhf8B55RXmo4m.name: Heft Crate
7qsNhf8B55RXmo4m.description:
Requirements The dockhand is adjacent to a crate

Effect The dockhand picks up a crate and heaves it up to 15 feet. Upon landing, the crate breaks open in a @Template[burst|distance:5]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain until cleared.

mkdTuwH7RBKEjtYR.name: Swig
mkdTuwH7RBKEjtYR.description:
The dockhand Interacts to either draw a bottle of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UMAXLDpI6YLSfYX1]{Alcohol} or pick up a nearby unattended bottle of alcohol and drink the whole thing.

For 1 minute, the dockhand gains a +2 item bonus to melee damage rolls and saving throws against fear, but they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

Qfkh85XuHvAlt1Su.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Qfkh85XuHvAlt1Su.description: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

oxY72lUlDZ1DPZJU.name: Protean Anatomy
oxY72lUlDZ1DPZJU.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Z1GpEdQSizMCFohO.name: Change Shape
Z1GpEdQSizMCFohO.description:
The voidworm takes on the appearance of a Tiny animal. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

3SBu5uViF2n65dfu.name: Confounding Lash
3SBu5uViF2n65dfu.description: A creature hit by the voidworm's tail Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical hit). A successful @Check[will|dc:22] save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.

PLPKdmnt6YIHpbHr.name: Divide
PLPKdmnt6YIHpbHr.description: In any round the voidworm ouroboros has less than half its total Hit Points, it can split into two standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.ciLdEf6sld8h2a2j]{Voidworms} which assume normal statistics for that creature.

kc6DFUOCiUeP1zqU.name: Command an Animal
kc6DFUOCiUeP1zqU.description: The druid directs their animal companion, giving it two Actions to use.

DKl1gjw3x5kfJLej.name: Support
DKl1gjw3x5kfJLej.description: The halfling druid's animal companion supports its master's attacks, tearing tendons with each opening. Until the start of the druid's next turn, any Strikes that damage a target that the animal companion threatens give the target a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (-10 on a critical success). While using Support, the only other actions an animal companion can use on its turn are movement actions to get into position. If an animal companion has used any other actions on its turn, it cannot support its master.

MDYvDrMtPOuocfAw.name: Bespell Primal Weapon
MDYvDrMtPOuocfAw.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Webhekiz's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell. Effect Webhekiz channels primal energy into his scepter or another wooden weapon, causing it to bloom a poisonous flower or sprout prickly thorns. Until the end of Webhekiz's turn, the weapon deals an extra @Damage[1d6[poison]] or @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage.

Z81r97NaA0M8y014.name: Squad Tactics
Z81r97NaA0M8y014.description: Webhekiz directs his guards to a more strategic position. Each guard can spend their reaction to Stride.

T8nBk0ezArDOrf3L.name: Berserk
T8nBk0ezArDOrf3L.description: A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 8 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

YwqogTIY2G2czSOJ.name: Electric Reflexes
YwqogTIY2G2czSOJ.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} an adjacent creature. The creature also takes @Damage[1d4[electricity]] damage on a success, or @Damage[2d4[electricity]] damage on a critical success.

rw114kpT2m0wUT8o.name: Golem Antimagic
rw114kpT2m0wUT8o.description:
Harmed by fire (@Damage[2d6[untyped]], @Damage[1d4[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by electricity (area effects @Damage[1d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

K6maxzMaNSh637Z0.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
K6maxzMaNSh637Z0.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell on the golem affects it normally.

A14FpYQMqcimPbMK.name: Berserk Slam
A14FpYQMqcimPbMK.description:
Requirements The golem is berserk

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d4 extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13)
Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).description:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.name: Slow
TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

0JEYl8M45a3g4eGC.name: Virulent Burst
0JEYl8M45a3g4eGC.description: When a polluted leshy dies, they release a burst of toxic natural energy. Each living non-plant creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save).

ZQ4aZGpHHJJ89Psl.name: Bitter Harvest
ZQ4aZGpHHJJ89Psl.description:
When a plum leshy hits with their rotten fruit Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to all plum leshys' bitter harvest for 1 hour.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Once it succeeds at its save to recover from the sickened condition, it is immune to all plum leshys' bitter harvest for 1 hour.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the target also takes a -1 penalty on all saves to recover from the sickened condition for 1 hour.

MYYDI70jXW4j0eRY.name: Berserk
MYYDI70jXW4j0eRY.description: A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 20 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

rcuQydAZzvprj9rQ.name: Electric Reflexes
rcuQydAZzvprj9rQ.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} an adjacent creature. The creature also takes @Damage[1d8[electricity]] damage on a success, or @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage on a critical success.

FWx8LrXvRVv2hzGh.name: Golem Antimagic
FWx8LrXvRVv2hzGh.description:
Harmed by fire (@Damage[2d10[untyped]], @Damage[1d8[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by electricity (area effects @Damage[2d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Mh9Hxq31c6Zrpg2e.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
Mh9Hxq31c6Zrpg2e.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell on the golem affects it normally.

h3cqmvV6SeQMj59F.name: Berserk Slam
h3cqmvV6SeQMj59F.description:
Requirements The golem is berserk

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d6 extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

G2Z2db8u2Np04kXo.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
G2Z2db8u2Np04kXo.description: Like normal objects, Synthetic Khismar has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage he takes by an amount equal to his Hardness. Once Synthetic Khismar is reduced to fewer than half his Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, his construct armor breaks and his AC is reduced to 23.

plKKjJqfaK7sTlfD.name: Overcharge
plKKjJqfaK7sTlfD.description:
Trigger Synthetic Khismar takes electricity damage

Effect Synthetic Khismar gains resistance 20 to electricity against the triggering attack and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Quickened Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

7gJE0E093kut3vOe.name: Programmed Combo
7gJE0E093kut3vOe.description: Synthetic Khismar makes two storm-fist Strikes against a single target. If either of the attacks deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Synthetic Khismar's next turn. His multiple attack penalty increases after making both attacks.

kSuzy5HtYGE123Jj.name: Self-Destruct
kSuzy5HtYGE123Jj.description:
Requirements Synthetic Khismar has 20 HP or fewer

Effect Synthetic Khismar explodes in a ball of burning plasma, destroying himself completely and dealing @Damage[10d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic])

Special Synthetic Khismar automatically activates this ability as a free action when brought to 0 Hit Points.

a2dm4JUbb4joEyEX.name: Technology Control
a2dm4JUbb4joEyEX.description:
Frequency once per turn

Range 100 feet

Effect Synthetic Khismar chooses the target of one technological construct or hazard; if this would cause the technological construct or hazard to attack a creature it would not normally attack, it takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its attack rolls and DCs against that creature.

M7HgZjthpPfkQ6JR.name: Nimble Dodge
M7HgZjthpPfkQ6JR.description:
Requirements The rebel can't use this reaction while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}

Trigger The rebel is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the rogue can see

Effect The rebel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack.

0oOSQiQIVGAxQ4QU.name: Sneak Attack
0oOSQiQIVGAxQ4QU.description: The rebel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

fbEJgRG5LQXuWO2D.name: Surprise Attack
fbEJgRG5LQXuWO2D.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the rebel.

Rabid Squirrel Swarm.name: Rabid Squirrel Swarm
Rabid Squirrel Swarm.description: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

wakLLGLUq65OLNcq.name: Rabies
wakLLGLUq65OLNcq.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:14|traits:disease]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}(1 day)

Stage 5 dead

e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.name: Swarming Claws and Teeth
e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.description:
Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save.

A creature affected by this attack can spend 2 actions on its turn to attempt another @Check[reflex|dc:17] to remove the clumsy condition.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage

Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and is exposed to rabies.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is clumsy 2, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and is exposed to rabies.

spNRRSc7ND3kF7i4.name: Swear Vengeance
spNRRSc7ND3kF7i4.description:
Trigger A creature that Reast can see damages a follower of Groetus other than Reast

Effect Reast gains the effect of a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike} spell. If Reast makes an attack roll against anyone other than the triggering creature, the true strike ends with no effect.

Reast can use this reaction once per day.

CbM2Ev4StbN7nZba.name: Channel Smite
CbM2Ev4StbN7nZba.description: Reast expends a prepared @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and makes a melee Strike. Instead of the normal effect of the spell, its void damage is added to the Strike's damage.

DDLIzIAxlzUrB9vi.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Illusions

2ARLUBlfsZl5sNfY.name: Run Away!
2ARLUBlfsZl5sNfY.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Zatqualmish

Effect Zatqualmish Strides up to 10 feet (or his Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). He must end his movement in a location that isn't within 5 feet of a foe.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Kobold Warrior (1-14).name: Kobold Warrior (1-14)
Kobold Warrior (1-14).description:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can.
