While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.name: Hurried Retreat
dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.description:
Requirements The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

xjE0NuW7F17ZDU1Y.name: Sneak Attack
xjE0NuW7F17ZDU1Y.description: The kobold warrior deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7Rg3TQGFjt5uWzLw.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
7Rg3TQGFjt5uWzLw.description:
Like normal objects, the statue of Set has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

WPghLMZPRFiy5n4O.name: Brazier
WPghLMZPRFiy5n4O.description:
The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach.

Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue.

Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal 2d8 fire damage.

HeOOQ9BnUPuR38pL.name: Burn Alive
HeOOQ9BnUPuR38pL.description: The statue grinds a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d6[fire],1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.

g4bgMsZVwwgxGNvn.name: Spooky
g4bgMsZVwwgxGNvn.description: The scarecrow does not take a penalty to Intimidation checks when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action against targets with whom it does not share a language.

jJV1omMqKQ4YPobw.name: Haunting Assault
jJV1omMqKQ4YPobw.description: The scarecrow makes two claw Strikes against a single creature, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} that creature.

0a1tbtoAffmRieGK.name: Sudden Charge
0a1tbtoAffmRieGK.description: The scarecrow Strides up to twice its speed. If it ends its movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, it can make a claw Strike against that enemy.

TEV2qu72qFMG8lL9.name: Woodwalk
TEV2qu72qFMG8lL9.description: The scarecrow ignores difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

BBPEHOEYoQMJzXNe.name: Cheap Shot
BBPEHOEYoQMJzXNe.description: The bandit disciple deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} creatures.

ziSoWu9CFACoFzPp.name: Dirty Trick
ziSoWu9CFACoFzPp.description:
Requirements A bandit disciple is holding a pouch of fine sand.

Effect The disciple Strides. If they end their movement adjacent to an enemy, they can make a @Check[deception|name:Deception Check vs. Target Perception] check against that enemy's Perception DC.

Critical Success As success, and the enemy also takes 2 extra precision damage.

Success The enemy takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Failure No effect.

Critical Failure The bandit disciple drops their pouch of fine sand, spilling and rendering it useless.

jt23ck8yjid74oyb.name: Homunculus Poison
jt23ck8yjid74oyb.description:
A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an Interact action.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:13]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

ef2SkweU3ISWsZdc.name: Attach
ef2SkweU3ISWsZdc.description:
When a barbed bloodseeker hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing} the creature, but the bloodseeker moves with that creature rather than holding it in place.

The bloodseeker is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached. If the bloodseeker is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained blood from, that creature takes @Damage[1[bleed]] damage. Escaping the attach or removing the bloodseeker in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

53Gp7LzK8oOBsDv8.name: Blood Drain
53Gp7LzK8oOBsDv8.description:
Requirements The bloodseeker is attached to a creature.

Effect The bloodseeker uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals [[/r 1d6]]{1d6 damage}, and the bloodseeker gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a bloodseeker is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

3lJeIWVDrKS0fhEI.name: Slow
3lJeIWVDrKS0fhEI.description: A mummy is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

S7zsUkdZKXOhb4jT.name: Tail Lash
S7zsUkdZKXOhb4jT.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of Ahrkinos's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect Ahrkinos attempts to Strike the triggering creature with his tail. If he hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

OsTExLtsjB0OOmeN.name: Caustic Mucus
OsTExLtsjB0OOmeN.description:
Ahrkinos spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[7d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage and take a -5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent acid damage.

Ahrkinos can't use Caustic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Caustic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

FyIAK0FbxvvCk4pq.name: Draconic Frenzy
FyIAK0FbxvvCk4pq.description: Ahrkinos makes one fangs Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

ju0usdUL59TxG4xz.name: Old Bones
ju0usdUL59TxG4xz.description: Ahrkinos's age has left him infirm and makes it difficult for him to fly. Ahrkinos becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} if he uses more than one Fly action to fly in a single round. His Speed Surge is considered one Fly action for this purpose. In addition, he immediately begins to fall at the end of his turn if he is flying, but treats the fall as 40 feet shorter.

pW0ymC5menGBt1Te.name: Speed Surge
pW0ymC5menGBt1Te.description: Ahrkinos moves up to twice his Speed. He can do this three times per day.

jas8bT1w5xGIzMab.name: Covetous Flames
jas8bT1w5xGIzMab.description: Any weapon the ascendant holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

Amvw7x9z5fAeJSBT.name: Furious Wings
Amvw7x9z5fAeJSBT.description: The ascendant beats their wings in a frenzied motion, creating a powerful blast of wind that disperses fog and gases and blows objects of light Bulk or less away. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the ascendant must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be pushed 5 feet away from the ascendant, or 10 feet on a critical failure. A flying creature that fails its save gets a critical failure instead.

sbxxFAbVjAmbOkl6.name: Personality Fragments
sbxxFAbVjAmbOkl6.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of its donor soul's personality, though none of that creature's memories. This causes a soulbound doll to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits.

EpANWjwZgbsRQx4e.name: Too Small to Wade
EpANWjwZgbsRQx4e.description: Kanker is too small to easily traverse through the slurry in this room. It treats the slurry as difficult terrain.

laWT7LBJYDVS40m7.name: Site Bound
laWT7LBJYDVS40m7.description: Diggen Thrune's ghost cannot leave the keep while Nashaxian still watches it. If Nashaxian is rendered unable to watch over him (such as if the PCs bind the devil to the keep), then Diggen can leave the keep. Still, his soul cannot pass on to the afterlife until he fulfills the terms of his contract.

kXqOHnfwM8HqrPlD.name: Object Habitation
kXqOHnfwM8HqrPlD.description: Diggen Thrune can occupy a magical object. Diggen can't be targeted or harmed while occupying an object, but he can only exit the object with the assistance of a mortal in possession of the object.

LyedbTfBV8gCzNKN.name: Rejuvenation
LyedbTfBV8gCzNKN.description:
Setting Diggen free from his contractual obligations with Nashaxian allows him to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

HWTDoAwAV3h8IO81.name: Frightful Moan
HWTDoAwAV3h8IO81.description: Diggen Thrune laments his fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

xm0eH21nCOMo8F81.name: -2 Untyped to Will Saves vs. Higher-ranked Cultists

mQrjQnHOVokI31N7.name: Fanatical Frenzy
mQrjQnHOVokI31N7.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither fatigued nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute.

While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3Wtzyb0ZgkaC7vHY]{Effect: Fanatical Frenzy}

Squirrel Swarm (1-04).name: Squirrel Swarm (1-04)
Squirrel Swarm (1-04).description: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.name: Swarming Claws and Teeth
e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.description:
Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save.

A creature affected by this attack can spend 2 actions on it's turn to attempt another @Check[reflex|dc:17] to remove the clumsy condition.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is clumsy 2, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Kobold Scout (1-14).name: Kobold Scout (1-14)
Kobold Scout (1-14).description:
Most kobolds encountered outside of a well-defended warren or lair are kobold scouts, creatures trained for stalking and the hunt.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

0qvSsLdTulsncbsi.name: Hurried Retreat
0qvSsLdTulsncbsi.description:
Requirements The kobold scout is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold scout Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

iwUe2P7Cd2ELOfVj.name: Sneak Attack
iwUe2P7Cd2ELOfVj.description: The kobold warrior deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

xTQYZZttOMz9MVgS.name: Bloodsoaked Soil (Regeneration 20)
xTQYZZttOMz9MVgS.description:
Generations of Bhopanese bloodshed have soaked Bhopan's soil, giving the Thorned Monarch a vast reservoir of energy to sustain their manifestation. As long as the manifestation is touching the soil of Bhopan, it has regeneration 20.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Regeneration]

NxngWgZtaOW0WD2E.name: Blood Siphon
NxngWgZtaOW0WD2E.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Effect The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that the manifestation siphons up with its proboscis. The manifestation regains @Damage[10[healing]] HP.

VjkGsLeNr9G8Zjc1.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust
VjkGsLeNr9G8Zjc1.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}).

osgMDgbEHzO0FStB.name: Capsize
osgMDgbEHzO0FStB.description:
Requirements The manifestation is standing on the deck of the Unsinkable.

Effect The manifestation shakes the ship violently. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} every foe on the Unsinkable (roll one @Check[athletics] check and compare the result to each foe's Fortitude DC).

pw19mLv7uKgx3isc.name: Flutter
pw19mLv7uKgx3isc.description: The manifestation Flies. Any creature it passes within 30 feet of during its Flutter is exposed to its hallucinatory scale dust.

Av2ZHeTLnI3Ezbhz.name: Pack Attack
Av2ZHeTLnI3Ezbhz.description: The cinder wolf's Strikes deal 1d4 extra precision damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

ibQcKxG3Lr3SVLIK.name: Ravenous Giant Centipede Venom
ibQcKxG3Lr3SVLIK.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

roVzfImlMLmqQTZT.name: Light Weakness
roVzfImlMLmqQTZT.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell) deals additional damage to the shadow wisp.

PsjwOHj53WzpVuM0.name: Shroud
PsjwOHj53WzpVuM0.description:
Requirements The shadow wisp's previous action was a hit against an adjacent creature with its shadow tendril Strike.

Effect The shadow wisp @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps} into the creature's space and attempts an @Check[acrobatics|defense:reflex] check against the target's Reflex DC to attach itself to the target's shadow.

As long as it remains attached, it moves with the target and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to attacks from the target. The target can spend a move action on its turn to attempt a Reflex save against the wisp's Acrobatics DC to escape the shroud.

UQLU4oGuKYLB11Xt.name: Stretch Shadow
UQLU4oGuKYLB11Xt.description:
Requirements The shadow wisp is attached to a living creature.

Effect The shadow wisp slips into the attached creature's shadow, dealing it @Damage[1d6[void]] damage. It can use the attached creature's shadow to make a shadow tendril Strike against another target up to 10 feet away

hFD2ZHQfMo1HXfRw.name: Sneak Attack
hFD2ZHQfMo1HXfRw.description: The Hungry Blade apprentice deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

bIfNh5KTSnxNkrR4.name: Surprise Attack
bIfNh5KTSnxNkrR4.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Hungry Blade apprentice.

rJMf5hrHOn7BfbcR.name: You're Next
rJMf5hrHOn7BfbcR.description:
Trigger The Hungry Blade apprentice reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points

Effect Hungry Blade apprentice prisoner attempts an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature it can see and that can see them.

BLfuJnWHSAdbdQun.name: Slow
BLfuJnWHSAdbdQun.description: A mummy shambler is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

9tlvmwp5ukp4ia1s.name: Stench of Decay
9tlvmwp5ukp4ia1s.description: 5 feet. The Blue Streak mage emits a scent of putrid rot in a 5-foot emanation. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the aura is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

289il3xluutdu35h.name: Drain Bonded Item
289il3xluutdu35h.description:
Frequency once per day Requirements The Blue Streak mage hasn't taken an action yet on this turn

Effect The Blue Streak mage expends the power stored in their mace. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

2SD9Oew6CWLr3CAl.name: Self-Loathing
2SD9Oew6CWLr3CAl.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

JBBP9K02ID8ktDLO.name: Vermin Empathy
JBBP9K02ID8ktDLO.description: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

GBdzvjAv6nIa7dcT.name: Baleful Blade
GBdzvjAv6nIa7dcT.description: Any creature affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane} spell is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Gwibble.

KPfQHBfNzT4tVt5Z.name: Hidden Movement
KPfQHBfNzT4tVt5Z.description: If Gwibble starts his turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by a creature or merely @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Gwibble's attacks until the end of Gwibble's turn.

cG1xtYEwGsdMr5Vc.name: Sneak Attack
cG1xtYEwGsdMr5Vc.description: Gwibble deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

QeN7G8z5SfDJxQR5.name: Vengeful Anger
QeN7G8z5SfDJxQR5.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

Biloko Warrior (1-16).name: Biloko Warrior (1-16)
Biloko Warrior (1-16).description:
Bilokos prefer to move in small, stealthy packs through dark, isolated sections of the forest. When a band of bilokos finds a suitable hunting ground, they claim the area exclusively, digging pit traps, crafting snares from vines, and building blinds high in trees where they can lie in ambush.

Bilokos are crocodile-snouted fey who stalk the Mwangi Jungle and feast upon the flesh of humanoids. As cunning as they are vicious, bilokos employ deadly traps and guerrilla hunting tactics to capture prey-typically hapless explorers or, occasionally, wayward villagers, many of whom believe bilokos to be cruel ancestral spirits. The most powerful of these creatures, known as elokos, wield potent transformative magic.

Bilokos have a fondness for bells, and the sound of ringing bells often indicates their presence. In addition to carrying and ringing them while out hunting, bilokos sometimes enchant bells with potent magic, or hang them on strings to serve as alarms for their encampments.

Bilokos look like slender but wiry humanoids with crocodile-like heads, rust-colored skin, and blood-red eyes. They eat only the meat of humanoids, though they can survive for extended periods of time on a single meal thanks to their snakelike ability to consume a Medium humanoid creature whole. They do this by unhinging their jaws and slowly swallowing the victim from head to foot. Thanks to their acidic saliva and sharp teeth, a biloko can masticate their food into an easy-to-digest pulp, grinding flesh and bone into a compact mush, even while swallowing; thus, they do not flinch while devouring meals two or three times their own size.

A recently-fed biloko can be easily recognized by their sagging, distended belly. However, despite their slow appearance, the fey is no less dangerous then, as they delight in killing and might have hungry comrades hiding nearby, waiting to feed.

XDCJ3PGz2z4zo3Fo.name: Inspired Feast
XDCJ3PGz2z4zo3Fo.description:
If a biloko feasts on a human corpse for 1 minute or more, they gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.EM0VP31B8CyjFD15]{Effect: Inspired Feast}

Zombie Shambler (PFS 1-03).name: Zombie Shambler (PFS 1-03)
Zombie Shambler (PFS 1-03).description:
A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

eulyI60JHNUYs39w.name: Slow
eulyI60JHNUYs39w.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Boggard Warrior (PFS 1-09).name: Boggard Warrior (PFS 1-09)
Boggard Warrior (PFS 1-09).description:
Boggard warriors exalt in single combat, and prefer to fight alone so that none can contest their kills. They have been known to pursue enemies who flee combat with a single-mindedness that seems almost supernatural.

Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians that thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develops arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare-everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

momzHh7zAZRC7Hob.name: Swamp Stride
momzHh7zAZRC7Hob.description: A boggard warrior ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

up8Xcig2FrwgbFfb.name: Terrifying Croak
up8Xcig2FrwgbFfb.description:
The boggard warrior unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

MEAPfylvHHHbTqOf.name: Tongue Grab
MEAPfylvHHHbTqOf.description:
If the boggard warrior hits a creature with its tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the boggard's tongue.

A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 15 and dealing at least 3 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

OKl9NRTHfhuy3HEM.name: Coven
OKl9NRTHfhuy3HEM.description:
Ahksiva adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

8ZrYGiwEvqJJkywh.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

XV7lbJiNSU2RJJC7.name: Sound Imitation
XV7lbJiNSU2RJJC7.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

PdzT0cwSvyNoUSn3.name: Betraying Touch
PdzT0cwSvyNoUSn3.description: Ahksiva touches a creature that doesn't realize she is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by her enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

sIvcRTrX2szocUez.name: Change Shape
sIvcRTrX2szocUez.description: Ahksiva can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

Jy7PS77XyrCJYeNh.name: Enfeebling Humors
Jy7PS77XyrCJYeNh.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.

rIBhqOZg1kmdtJo1.name: Exhale Miasma
rIBhqOZg1kmdtJo1.description: Ahksiva exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attempting a save as normal). She can't use Exhale Miasma again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exhale Miasma]]{1d4 rounds}

o7S40Yz5iEGQEvCf.name: +1 Circumstance Bonus to All Saves and AC vs. Traps

lsp2hh2h27s9mx3h.name: Deny Advantage
lsp2hh2h27s9mx3h.description: The burglar isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 4th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.

9kzhhqkqdgmmz59a.name: Nimble Dodge
9kzhhqkqdgmmz59a.description:
Trigger The burglar is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The burglar gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

6vlktdj56adk2ea6.name: Mobility
6vlktdj56adk2ea6.description: When the burglar Strides half their Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

kwRGlrcdylPLXrpL.name: Sneak Attack
kwRGlrcdylPLXrpL.description: The burglar deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

ditqy3m457g12j9a.name: Surprise Attack
ditqy3m457g12j9a.description: On the first round of combat, if the burglar rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

Dilapidated Alchemical Golem.name: Dilapidated Alchemical Golem
Dilapidated Alchemical Golem.description:
This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

Crafted of base materials and then magically animated into a powerful guardian, the legendary golem is a living construct that mindlessly obeys its creator's commands-often continuing to do so for years or even centuries after its creator's death. There exist two known methods of animating a golem. The traditional method involves harvesting and implanting an elemental soul or essence within the newly crafted host statue, a procedure seen as vile and blasphemous to those who value the sanctity of the soul; evil or amoral golem crafters tend to prefer this method. The other, less disreputable technique involves siphoning pure vitality energy into the statue to artificially imitate the creation of a soul. The result does not give the golem a true soul and is generally a more costly and time-consuming method of creation. Regardless of the method used, the resulting golem functions the same. A golem's unique animating force leaves it susceptible to certain forms of magic, but apart from these few weaknesses, it is impervious to magic and difficult to damage with weapons.

Golems work best in play as foes to vanquish rather than allies to accompany player characters on adventures. The process of creating a golem is time-consuming, expensive, and difficult, and only the most talented spellcasters or artisans can even hope to accomplish such an undertaking. While certain magical texts-so-called "golem manuals"-are said to aid golems crafters, for the most part the creation of a golem should be something left in the hands of the Game Master.

Golems have components that can be harvested as trophies or magical components; the value depends on the golem in question. Examples of components that can be harvested from golems are listed in the sidebars.

wWzb0lk8bt7fX26v.name: Alchemical Rupture
wWzb0lk8bt7fX26v.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the altered alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters, and any creatures hit are affected as listed (@Check[reflex|dc:16]).

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

5tth4S3MfBeAaXNe.name: Altered Alchemical Chambers
5tth4S3MfBeAaXNe.description:
The dilapidated alchemical golem's chemicals have changed after a long period of inactivity. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no alchemical effect):

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

q0uaGibf8YleEHPK.name: Golem Antimagic
q0uaGibf8YleEHPK.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[1d8[untyped]], @Damage[1d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

FxB9ftCZ0iMxKdq6.name: Alchemical Injection
FxB9ftCZ0iMxKdq6.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

The syringe exposes the creature to the effect rolled.

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] Alchemical Effect
1-2 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure)
3-4 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)
5-6 @Check[fortitude|dc:15] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} for 1 round (slowed for 2 rounds on a critical failure)

16fpu855iz8w3tyx.name: Sentry's Aim
16fpu855iz8w3tyx.description: The Blue Streak sentry aims carefully and fires. They make a ranged weapon Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus. The Strike ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, lesser cover, and standard cover, and reduces greater cover to standard cover.

xrfvDMXoDbXuMuon.name: Breath Weapon
xrfvDMXoDbXuMuon.description: The greater steel mephit breathes shards of iron in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures who fail their save against this effect also take @Damage[1d6[bleed]]. The greater steel mephit can't use its breath weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

YrvT18FY671eb3rT.name: Vitality Transfer
YrvT18FY671eb3rT.description:
Trigger The leshy crafter would take damage

Effect The leshy crafter uses his mystical link to the Abyssal shard to redirect the damage to a willing leshy of lower level within 30 feet. If this leshy is reduced to 0 HP as a result of the damage, the leshy crafter takes any remaining damage.

HBUzBG6pRbx2Oh3I.name: Claws from Below
HBUzBG6pRbx2Oh3I.description: The leshy crafter calls spiky roots that shoot up from the ground in the shape of Abyssal claws before retracting an instant later. This ability targets three @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot bursts} within 30 feet. Each creature on the ground in an affected area takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). A creature takes the same amount of damage no matter how many overlapping bursts it's caught in.

e71Zm0jOSEa9Fqvh.name: Leech Materials
e71Zm0jOSEa9Fqvh.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The leshy crafter calls forth materials and natural energies from the surrounding area, creating a brief vortex of flora and debris. Each non-plant creature within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of the leshy crafter takes @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[void]]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 void damage}, with a @Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save.

The debris cloud lasts until the leshy crafter's next turn; while the cloud lasts, all creatures within it become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the cloud become concealed to creatures within it.

DBqKshWaFMtNwbrX.name: Virulent Burst
DBqKshWaFMtNwbrX.description: When a polluted leshy dies, they release a burst of toxic natural energy. Each living non-plant creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:15|basic] save).

AWPOgXTMYvsJnMqt.name: Bitter Harvest
AWPOgXTMYvsJnMqt.description:
When a plum leshy hits with their rotten fruit Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to all plum leshys' bitter harvest for 1 hour.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Once it succeeds at its save to recover from the sickened condition, it is immune to all plum leshys' bitter harvest for 1 hour.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the target also takes a -1 penalty on all saves to recover from the sickened condition for 1 hour.

mqB9pue1K8Hsda84.name: Slow
mqB9pue1K8Hsda84.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

huzm1fO5UflfgPJJ.name: Rotting Aura
huzm1fO5UflfgPJJ.description:
10 feet. The zombie riding horse emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save) as its wounds fester.

Cc4ymamS7jlEqUhJ.name: Feast
Cc4ymamS7jlEqUhJ.description: The zombie warhorse Strikes with its jaws against an adjacent living creature or a creature that has died in the past hour. On a success, the zombie warhorse can feast upon the creature's flesh to heal itself. This restores @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points.

ljhwvKpqZJVVOClT.name: Gallop
ljhwvKpqZJVVOClT.description: The zombie warhorse Strides twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides.

Palace Guard (PFS 1-17).name: Palace Guard (PFS 1-17)
Palace Guard (PFS 1-17).description:
Guards are rank-and-file members of a town watch or city guard, trained to look for trouble, take down criminals, and follow orders. They are a match for only the most fledgling of adventurers and criminals, but, given time, the settlement can usually muster them in numbers sufficient to neutralize most threats.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. In good-aligned societies, these officials carry out their duties fairly. In neutral and evil ones, these officials can be harsh and cruel (with an altered alignment to reflect this), imposing severe punishments on those who can't pay for mercy.

xTQYZZttOMz9MVgS.name: Bloodsoaked Soil (Regeneration 20)
xTQYZZttOMz9MVgS.description:
Generations of Bhopanese bloodshed have soaked Bhopan's soil, giving the Thorned Monarch a vast reservoir of energy to sustain their manifestation. As long as the manifestation is touching the soil of Bhopan, it has regeneration 20.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Regeneration]

NxngWgZtaOW0WD2E.name: Blood Siphon
NxngWgZtaOW0WD2E.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet takes persistent bleed damage.

Effect The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that the manifestation siphons up with its proboscis. The manifestation regains @Damage[12[healing]] HP.

VjkGsLeNr9G8Zjc1.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust
VjkGsLeNr9G8Zjc1.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}).

osgMDgbEHzO0FStB.name: Capsize
osgMDgbEHzO0FStB.description:
Requirements The manifestation is standing on the deck of the Unsinkable.

Effect The manifestation shakes the ship violently. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} every foe on the Unsinkable (roll one @Check[athletics] check and compare the result to each foe's Fortitude DC).

pw19mLv7uKgx3isc.name: Flutter
pw19mLv7uKgx3isc.description: The manifestation Flies. Any creature it passes within 30 feet of during its Flutter is exposed to its hallucinatory scale dust.

TP3xm5YmyPLhXN4x.name: Powerful Charge
TP3xm5YmyPLhXN4x.description:
The mountain goat Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn attack.

If the mountain goat moved at least 20 feet, its Push increases to 10 feet on a hit.

MXbLjMNQLVtONCLJ.name: Hard to Grapple or Shove
MXbLjMNQLVtONCLJ.description: Little Zura gains a +2 to fortitude saves against attempts to grapple or shove.

lrRnr9DjnLq3LZtW.name: Belly Grease
lrRnr9DjnLq3LZtW.description: The slurk extrudes a slippery grease from its ventral glands to coat the floor under it and in a @Template[emanation|distance:5], turning the affected area into uneven ground for 10 minutes, after which it dries to a putrid crust. The DC to Balance across the slime is 17.

yAfsUQdcfEd9h8gf.name: Entangling Slime
yAfsUQdcfEd9h8gf.description:
A creature struck by a slurk's slime squirt becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -5-foot penalty to Speed for 1 hour or until the slime is removed. The slime can be removed with a total of three Interact actions by the entangled creature or creatures adjacent to the creature.

These actions don't need to be consecutive or made by the same creature.

jb8RUiIGfZeiY4LQ.name: Breath Weapon
jb8RUiIGfZeiY4LQ.description:
The fleshforge prototype breathes flames that deal @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The fleshforge prototype can't use its breath weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

NGpcOOJuyLudCfKX.name: Breath Weapon
NGpcOOJuyLudCfKX.description:
The fleshforge dreg breathes flames that deal @Damage[4d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The fleshforge dreg can't use its breath weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

qldRZ7tngibnrXJY.name: Metal Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
qldRZ7tngibnrXJY.description: A metallic sod hound can sense metal objects within 60 feet as if using the scent ability.

pZtADVw63emna9WY.name: Earth Glide
pZtADVw63emna9WY.description: The metallic sod hound can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock or metal. When it does so, the metallic sod hound moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

rEKdAdNENT3SDfy2.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

rPoBtnrj6lEKeg1k.name: Infernal Detonations
rPoBtnrj6lEKeg1k.description:
Trigger A creature Nashaxian can see steps on one of the 10-foot-by-10-foot patches of flame in the throne room hallway

Effect The creature and any other creatures above that patch take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage.

fZf5xHZsnU6ipHuI.name: Avernal Fever
fZf5xHZsnU6ipHuI.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

OAhLWgPPRoWhp4OS.name: Infernal Wound
OAhLWgPPRoWhp4OS.description:
Nashaxian's glaive Strike also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[flat|dc:15]. The DC is reduced to @Check[flat|dc:10] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 3.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 18 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

utjX4MdvBWi1fMme.name: Wriggling Beard
utjX4MdvBWi1fMme.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Nashaxian makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

BVUUAVpxPwrA9HmM.name: Roots
BVUUAVpxPwrA9HmM.description: The fleshforge prototype roots into the surface it is standing on. It gains fast healing 5 until it leaves that space.

Elite Sewer Ooze (Q9).name: Elite Sewer Ooze (Q9)
Elite Sewer Ooze (Q9).description:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.name: Motion Sense
VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.description: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.name: Filth Wave
mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[acid]] damage and take a -10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}). A creature can spend and Interact action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.

95kvqPPSJNio8vAK.name: Berserk
95kvqPPSJNio8vAK.description: A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

EcSG9mNyifTC1iWV.name: Golem Antimagic
EcSG9mNyifTC1iWV.description:
Harmed by fire (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[3d4[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

uzwUjI3gD8tO8Chh.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
uzwUjI3gD8tO8Chh.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

BaBWpspQzY07GuJo.name: Berserk Slam
BaBWpspQzY07GuJo.description:
Requirements The golem is berserk

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d6 extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

JxzeHD11ElnX6hHD.name: Slow
JxzeHD11ElnX6hHD.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

KEpC0W7eDEVTXcNz.name: Corpse Throwing
KEpC0W7eDEVTXcNz.description: A zombie minihulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw zombie shamblers, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands prone, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.

kM3mROlSp1JZ02yX.name: Wide Swing
kM3mROlSp1JZ02yX.description: The zombie minihulk makes a hunk of meat melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie minihulk's multiple attack penalty.

IPzJCY6pFm1DzEQH.name: Feed on Thoughts
IPzJCY6pFm1DzEQH.description: The cocoon unravels as it envelops a Small, Medium, or Large humanoid creature that's unconscious, willing, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by Hypnotic Thrum, and that is within reach of the cocoon's tendrils, moving into the creature's space as part of this action. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and take @Damage[2d6[mental],2d6[slashing]]{2d6 mental damage and 2d6 slashing damage} (double damage on a critical failure). Feeding on a creature's Thoughts doesn't end fascination caused by Hypnotic Thrum.

GuFdSjxJc9byaA8I.name: Hypnotic Thrum
GuFdSjxJc9byaA8I.description:
The thorned cocoon relays Qxal's telepathic coercions in either a @Template[line|distance:30] or a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Hypnotic Thrum, it becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}. For as long as it is fascinated, it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the thorned cocoon as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature is adjacent to the thorned cocoon, it stays still and doesn't act.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition doesn't end automatically. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the fascinated condition ends.

nk39gb38JIlNQo9N.name: Screaming Skull
nk39gb38JIlNQo9N.description: The skeleton removes its skull and throws it, making a jaws Strike with a range of 20 feet. It then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize: Intimidation} each foe within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of the target. The head bounces, rolls, or even flies back, returning to the skeleton at the start of its next turn. The skeleton is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until then.

Jinkin (PFS 1-17).name: Jinkin (PFS 1-17)
Jinkin (PFS 1-17).description:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.name: Sneak Attack
oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.name: Tinker
fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

Elite Ghast (PFS 1-07).name: Elite Ghast (PFS 1-07)
Elite Ghast (PFS 1-07).description:
Ghasts-feral, foul-smelling, and constantly hungry-are the more powerful kin of ghouls. They are relentless in the pursuit of their prey.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

dALR9L0wlW2puqiD.name: Stench
dALR9L0wlW2puqiD.description:
10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

mkwN7Fgq3DRnThOV.name: Consume Flesh
mkwN7Fgq3DRnThOV.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

IdfK6A7UpGkscuOG.name: Ghast Fever
IdfK6A7UpGkscuOG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

GBiarRqqq8qwyZtJ.name: Paralysis
GBiarRqqq8qwyZtJ.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

e7CxhtU5yoASkey8.name: Swift Leap
e7CxhtU5yoASkey8.description: The ghast jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

0viXaN1VbbHTmKVH.name: Lunge
0viXaN1VbbHTmKVH.description: The guard makes a Strike with a melee weapon, extending their reach by 5 feet for that Strike. If the weapon has the disarm, shove, or trip trait, the guard can use the corresponding action instead of a Strike.

176ENRQ6gtkKH70l.name: Broad Swipe
176ENRQ6gtkKH70l.description: The giant makes two Strikes with its glaive against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

MKk8hqN8SI42Lp0u.name: Terrifying Charge
MKk8hqN8SI42Lp0u.description:
The giant Strides and makes a horns Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage.

If the strike hits, the giant attempts to [[/act demoralize]] the target.

S7zsUkdZKXOhb4jT.name: Tail Lash
S7zsUkdZKXOhb4jT.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of Ahrkinos's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect Ahrkinos attempts to Strike the triggering creature with his tail. If he hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

OsTExLtsjB0OOmeN.name: Caustic Mucus
OsTExLtsjB0OOmeN.description:
Ahrkinos spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage and take a -5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent acid damage.

Ahrkinos can't use Caustic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Caustic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

FyIAK0FbxvvCk4pq.name: Draconic Frenzy
FyIAK0FbxvvCk4pq.description: Ahrkinos makes one fangs Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

ju0usdUL59TxG4xz.name: Old Bones
ju0usdUL59TxG4xz.description: Ahrkinos's age has left him infirm and makes it difficult for him to fly. Ahrkinos becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} if he uses more than one Fly action to fly in a single round. His Speed Surge is considered one Fly action for this purpose. In addition, he immediately begins to fall at the end of his turn if he is flying, but treats the fall as 40 feet shorter.

pW0ymC5menGBt1Te.name: Speed Surge
pW0ymC5menGBt1Te.description: Ahrkinos moves up to twice his Speed. He can do this three times per day.

H3YW50LUUhIJNYOq.name: Breath Weapon
H3YW50LUUhIJNYOq.description:
Muraxi breathes acid in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Muraxi can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

amaw365hesk7zkAH.name: Drench
amaw365hesk7zkAH.description: Muraxi puts out all fires in a @Template[emanation|distance:5]. She extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires ([[/r 1d20+10 #Counteract]]{+10 counteract modifier}).

Leopard (1-14).name: Leopard (1-14)
Leopard (1-14).description:
Leopards are among the smallest of the big cats, yet they are still dangerous creatures to tangle with. Leopard statistics can also be used for black panthers, white-spotted snow leopards, or tawny-coated cougars.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

uEjliLhQWBsVYCsE.name: Maul
uEjliLhQWBsVYCsE.description: The leopard makes two claw Strikes against a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. Both count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks are made.

iuFRjKw2PLJl3E3F.name: Pounce
iuFRjKw2PLJl3E3F.description: The leopard Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the leopard began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

8Hc25NUrYBwSHQuO.name: Sneak Attack
8Hc25NUrYBwSHQuO.description: The leopard deals 1d4 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Injured Weak Otyugh.name: Injured Weak Otyugh
Injured Weak Otyugh.description:
Lords of sewers, ditches, and landfllls, otyughs are filthy monstrosities that stomp about on three massive legs in search of tasty garbage and refuse. Using two barbed tentacles to grasp and tear, guided by a third with a proliferation of eyes at the end, the otyugh has perfectly adapted to life in its cramped, disgusting environment, where it uses its appendages to see into tight spaces and grasp hidden prey.

Most assume that otyughs originally evolved in swamps and moved into sewers as civilization encroached on their natural habitats. True or not, they are now one of the larger predators in those dank environs. Otyughs are territorial, but they have been known to form loose collectives, even giving each other important-sounding titles like 'king of offal' and 'duchess of slime' to indicate their rank and station in their sludgy underworld beneath the streets.

Those who run across an otyugh might be surprised to hear it speak, shouting at intruders to leave its putrid home or demanding tribute in the form of trash or other prizes of dubious nature.

r1SlNgELge3BicQv.name: Stench
r1SlNgELge3BicQv.description: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for the same duration on a critical failure). On a success, the creature is temporarily immune to the sickened and slowed effects of this stench for 1 hour. Regardless of the save, while within the aura, creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against diseases. An otyugh's stench is due to the offal and refuse that it wallows in, so cleaning the creature thoroughly (with create water and sufficient scrubbing, for example) deactivates the aura, while a sufficiently plugged nose allows an individual to avoid exposure to the stench.

eN5D2eJhQniMX2RG.name: Constrict
eN5D2eJhQniMX2RG.description:
@Damage[(1d4+3)[bludgeoning]] damage, @Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic]

The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

GHuGn3ZCUkbeSFiQ.name: Filth Fever
GHuGn3ZCUkbeSFiQ.description:
The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it remains Sickened (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

nQudJs5Bky0XvlDC.name: Reposition
nQudJs5Bky0XvlDC.description: The otyugh attempts to move all creatures that it has grabbed into other spaces within the reach of its tentacles, rolling a single Athletics check and comparing the result against each creature's Fortitude DC. On a failure, the creature remains in place, and on a critical failure, the creature is no longer grabbed.

RGcWTBHHWc1kj692.name: Spine Rake
RGcWTBHHWc1kj692.description: The young sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or Strides. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes @Damage[(1d4+2)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save).

P5danavcXSRsbC6b.name: Young Sea Serpent Algae
P5danavcXSRsbC6b.description:
The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent's neck is full of psychotropic algae.

Saving throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18|name:Young Sea Serpent Algae Poison]

Maximum duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and, if flying, spends its first action each turn to descend 20 feet (1 round)

K1rcnncWjOawSXCY.name: Blood Magic
K1rcnncWjOawSXCY.description: When a skeletal mage casts a spell, either it gains temporary Hit Points equal to the spell's rank for 1 round, or one target takes @Damage[1[void]] damage per spell rank (if the spell already deals void damage, combine this with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances).

94PThSMzYGoFw70x.name: Signature Spell
94PThSMzYGoFw70x.description: The skeletal mage can freely heighten the spells marked signature.

gsVVrzAcVpAl9UbW.name: Widen Spell
gsVVrzAcVpAl9UbW.description: The skeleton mage causes the next spell they cast to affect a wider area. If the next action they use is to Cast a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

kaqE1zf3XRrnK0Q6.name: Vitality Transfer
kaqE1zf3XRrnK0Q6.description:
Trigger The leshy crafter would take damage.

Effect The leshy crafter uses his mystical link to the Abyssal shard to redirect the damage to a willing leshy of lower level within 30 feet. If this leshy is reduced to 0 HP as a result of the damage, the leshy crafter takes any remaining damage.

88mycrSkjCeAndzB.name: Claws from Below
88mycrSkjCeAndzB.description: The leshy crafter calls spiky roots that shoot up from the ground in the shape of Abyssal claws before retracting an instant later. This ability targets three @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot bursts} within 30 feet. Each creature on the ground in an affected area takes @Damage[2d10[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). A creature takes the same amount of damage no matter how many overlapping bursts it's caught in.

3AKAiN0FSZsw7Wnx.name: Leech Materials
3AKAiN0FSZsw7Wnx.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The leshy crafter calls forth materials and natural energies from the surrounding area, creating a brief vortex of flora and debris. Each non-plant creature within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of the leshy crafter takes @Damage[3d6[piercing],3d6[void]]{3d6 piercing damage and 3d6 void damage}, with a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save.

The debris cloud lasts until the leshy crafter's next turn; while the cloud lasts, all creatures within it become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the cloud become concealed to creatures within it.

n1960SvW9XyzQmK6.name: Brutish Shove
n1960SvW9XyzQmK6.description:
The rebel brute makes a single Strike with a two-handed melee weapon. If the rebel brute hits a target that is their size or smaller, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of the brute's turn, and the brute can automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.yNry1xMZqdWHncbV]{Shove: Athletics} it with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect, if the Strike was a critical hit). If the brute moves to follow the target, that movement doesn't trigger reactions. This Strike has the following failure effect.

Failure The target becomes off-guard until the end of the elite rebel brute's current turn.

dtEgeRVfaBKOAFqC.name: Self-Loathing
dtEgeRVfaBKOAFqC.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

bh0AjbzFq7HOYNQ8.name: Vermin Empathy
bh0AjbzFq7HOYNQ8.description: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

oFJxSryL64MZfJZ3.name: Baleful Blade
oFJxSryL64MZfJZ3.description: Any creature affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane} spell is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Gwibble.

f7M3ddbP53ssgnxZ.name: Sneak Attack
f7M3ddbP53ssgnxZ.description: The mitflit sneak deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

rWbXGNBbgK1ewGUS.name: Vengeful Anger
rWbXGNBbgK1ewGUS.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

rx882mNLVHE8Barx.name: Stench
rx882mNLVHE8Barx.description:
10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

sRQxlciuBmbK3PiH.name: Consume Flesh
sRQxlciuBmbK3PiH.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

7YszLjl6PF1zsfgO.name: Ghast Fever
7YszLjl6PF1zsfgO.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

QI6n6Fz9snAcIgw9.name: Paralysis
QI6n6Fz9snAcIgw9.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

i6eC5s4d2lMzxAld.name: Swift Leap
i6eC5s4d2lMzxAld.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

8mx81oDzILiF7y1b.name: Consume Flesh
8mx81oDzILiF7y1b.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

guq0UPN12B2EafM4.name: Ghoul Fever
guq0UPN12B2EafM4.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

69r59N0XP1Azzagw.name: Paralysis
69r59N0XP1Azzagw.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

IsVn2lDS2alHU8Lr.name: Swift Leap
IsVn2lDS2alHU8Lr.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18).name: Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18)
Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18).description:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.name: Slow
TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

IKKlqoLTFtO3pbQV.name: Rotting Aura
IKKlqoLTFtO3pbQV.description:
10 feet. The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage as its wounds fester. Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.

DGIe8y52OV9orOUE.name: Storm Smite
DGIe8y52OV9orOUE.description:
Trigger The storm acolyte critically hits with a scimitar Strike

Effect The storm acolyte releases a blast of lighting in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on the target. A creature in the area other than the storm acolyte takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save). On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

bq76jqjayvhmedu4.name: Attach
bq76jqjayvhmedu4.description: When a Glass River midge hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the midge moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The midge is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached. If the midge is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained blood from, that creature takes @Damage[1[bleed]] damage. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escaping} the attach or removing the midge in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

kgv7degr3lhh4seo.name: Blood Drain
kgv7degr3lhh4seo.description:
Requirements The Glass River midge is attached to a creature

Effect The midge uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals [[/r {1d4+2}]]{1d4+2 damage}, and the midge gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a midge is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

bj89p5g5bjbg5yxr.name: Camouflage
bj89p5g5bjbg5yxr.description: The Glass River midge can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in natural environments even if it doesn't have cover.

Frog Swarm.name: Frog Swarm
Frog Swarm.description: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.name: Distraction
e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.description: Any living creature within the area of a frog swarm must attempt a @Check[will|dc:12] save. Humanoids that fail this save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure). Animals are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} on a successful save, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} on a failure, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and fleeing on a critical failure.

6bCGpiG6oGO6V2Wt.name: Nimble Dodge
6bCGpiG6oGO6V2Wt.description:
Trigger Mirror Lelzeshin is targeted by a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see.

Effect Mirror Lelzeshin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

9tMv3wYrwFkBuEO7.name: Sneak Attack
9tMv3wYrwFkBuEO7.description: Mirror Lelzeshin deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

jlEPZD4gjnNtd69G.name: Crowd Aid
jlEPZD4gjnNtd69G.description:
The crowd leader ignores difficult terrain caused by friendly crowds.

Creatures within or adjacent to friendly crowds are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the crowd leader's attacks.

xJXc7YAzIsrG05Lm.name: Pack Attack
xJXc7YAzIsrG05Lm.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

7vpv7NXWz21FuAFB.name: Pounce
7vpv7NXWz21FuAFB.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the ability's Strike.

0XrGeOGMJU5c6OJD.name: Sneak Attack
